name: mixed phenotype acute leukemia
definition: An acute leukemia that is characterized by the occurrance of more than one type of leukemia at the same time resulting from either the occurance of both acute lymphoblastic leukemia blasts and acute myeloblastic leukemia blasts at the same time or leukemic blasts that have features of both ALL and AML on the same cell. [url:https\://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/29021517]

clinicalTrials.title: Phase I Trial of the Selective Inhibitor of Nuclear Export, KPT-330, in Relapsed Childhood ALL and AML
HA-1 T TCR T Cell Immunotherapy for the Treating of Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Acute Leukemia After Donor Stem Cell Transplant
A Study of SNDX-5613 in R/R Leukemias Including Those With an MLLr/KMT2A Gene Rearrangement or NPM1 Mutation (AUGMENT-101)
